page.title: 12PETS IN AYLESFORD AND ECCLES
page.content: The result of a small sample survey of Eccles, taken by the children of St Peters, showed that 30% of the household's kept a cat.The children of St Peter's School were surveyed regarding dog ownership,revealing that a similar proportion of families kept a dog. Twice as many people chose to keep pedigree rather than mongrel dogs.Less than 10% had bred from their dogs.To our surprise not one family attended dog training classes.Less than 10% feed their dogs on fresh meat.About twelve estavlishments in the block either keep horses or provide livery facilities for others to do so. Horse riding is an important recreational pursuit in the area.
